content.description:
Park at mile marker 29 and most likely you will be able to follow a skin track or snow machine track up onto the Girls Glacier. The one big draw back to this area is that it sees a lot of snowmachine traffic and this can pose a danger as both skinners/climbers and the snowmachiners use the same avi prone area to access the glacier at 4500ft. On the way down there is ample room to find fresh tracks.

 The majority of the route meanders through 30-35 deg terrain, the summit pyramid pushes 45 deg. This is a glaciated route, so take care, even though there are very few crevasses they still exists.
content.protection: Glacier kit, crampons and ice axe.

content.description: Girls Mt. is made for powder skiing! It is best to make an ascent of this peak when there is enough snow on the ground to cover up the brush down low and make for easier travel, although you can hike up the pipeline access road in the late spring/summer to minimize the bush whack to Alaska Grade 2+ Bush Whack.
